p: Following SEM analyses ( Figure 3), the aerobic growth of the C. albicans cells revealed typical yeast cells displaying characteristic bud scars ( Figure 3a). No hyphal development was observed in the different cultures with or without EO or with Amph-B. Following the addition of EO or its vapor, the external morphology of the cells did not appear as smooth as that of the untreated cells, which indicates a possible loss of cytosolic volume. Indeed, EO and its vapor distorted the cell wall surface ( Figure 3b,c, arrows). These distorted cell features were comparable to those observed in the presence of AmB ( Figure 3d, arrows).
